sect1.title: How to Create Custom URLs with Joomla! 1.5
sect1.para: In Joomla! 1.5 the building and parsing of URL's was completly refactored. Using the Joomla! framework, it is now possible to implement custom URLs in your component. Another improvement is that this still works even if Joomla! runs not on an Apache server or if the mod_rewrite module isn't available.

A good example for this is "Welcome to Joomla!" article, the first link with mod_rewrite activiated, and the second with mod_rewrite activated: http://www.example.com/index.php/the­news/1­latest­news/1­welcome­to­joomla

sect2.title: Get the system database object
sect2.para: The easiest way to get a database object is by getting the system database object returned by the JFactory class. The static method JFactory::getDBO() returns a singleton instance of the system database object regardless of scope and is the recommended way of getting this object.
sect2.programlisting: // This gets the database object using the JFactory class $db = &JFactory::getDBO();

sect2.title: Creating a custom database object
sect2.para: Joomla! 1.5 introduces the concept of database drivers which will allow you to get database objects that point to different database sources.
sect2.programlisting: // Create a new database object $myDB = new JDatabase::getInstance( $options );
